de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IExtDeviceGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IExtDeviceGroup

  • public class IExtDeviceGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing specific methods for external connected Devices.
    Description:
    This class realizes the nested interface with special methods for external Devices (like Gate People Counter or Function Units) for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the IExtDev member of ReaderModule.

    • Method Detail

      • detectPeopleCounter

        public int detectPeopleCounter()
                        throws FeException
        Request of connected People-Counter
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The Reader starts an internal detection process.

      • getPeopleCounterMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,GatePeopleCounter> getPeopleCounterMap()
                                                                           throws FeException
        Returns a map with People Counter objects
        Returns:
        Map with People Counter objects which represents physical People Counter connected at a Reader
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Each People Counter object represents a physical People Counter connected at a Reader.

      • getRootFunctionUnit

        public FunctionUnitBase getRootFunctionUnit(int antennaNo)
        Method to get the root Function Unit object
        Parameters:
        antennaNo - Antenna number of Reader, where the Function Unit is connected
        Returns:
        Function Unit, which must be casted to the specific type
        Description:
        This method must be called to get the Function Unit object in cascade level 1, which must be connected at the specified Antenna number of the Reader and must be created first with createRootFunctionUnit(int, int).
        The returned object must be casted to the correct Function Unit type.

        Example:
         
  NOTE: reader is an object of type de.feig.FEDM.Core.ReaderModule
 
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.*;
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.ExternalDevice.*;

  HFAntennaMultiplexer*  HfMux = null;
  UHFAntennaMultiplexer* UhfMux = null;
  HFDynamicAntennaTuner* HfDat = null;

  FunctionUnitBase* FU = reader.IExtDevice.getRootFunctionUnit(1);

  if(FU instanceof HFAntennaMultiplexer)
  {
      HfMux = (HFAntennaMultiplexer)FU;
      ...
  }
  else if(FU instanceof HFDynamicAntennaTuner)
  {
      HfDat = (HFDynamicAntennaTuner)FU;
      ...
  }
  else if(FU instanceof UHFAntennaMultiplexer)
  {
      UhfMux = (UHFAntennaMultiplexer)FU;
      ...
  }

      • createRootFunctionUnit

        public int createRootFunctionUnit(int antennaNo,
                                  int functionUnitType)
                           throws FeException
        Fabric-Method to create an Function Unit object of specified type
        Parameters:
        antennaNo - Antenna number of Reader, where the Function Unit is connected
        functionUnitType - Type of Function Unit to be created to (see FunctionUnitBase)
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method must be called to create the Function Unit in cascade level 1 and which is connected at the specified Antenna number of the Reader.
        The created Function Unit is managed by the Reader class and destroyed automatically together with the Reader object.
        For destroying manually, call destroyRootFunctionUnit, which destroys all childs too.

      • destroyRootFunctionUnit

        public int destroyRootFunctionUnit(int antennaNo)
                            throws FeException
        Method to destroy an Function Unit object
        Parameters:
        antennaNo - Antenna number of Reader, where the Function Unit is connected
        Returns:
        status
        • 0 if OK
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method can optionally be called to destroy the Function Unit in cascade level 1 and all associated childs.
        The created Function Unit is managed by the Reader class and destroyed normally automatically together with the Reader object.

      • createChildFunctionUnit

        public FunctionUnitBase createChildFunctionUnit(int antennaNo,
                                                int functionUnitType,
                                                int cascadeLevel)
                                         throws FeException
        Create a new Function Unit object (only for internal use)
        Parameters:
        antennaNo - number of antenna, where the Function Unit is connected
        functionUnitType - type of Function Unit
        cascadeLevel - cascade level
        Returns:
        Function Unit object of requested type
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Only for internal use.
